#Text=Add a Computer to a Domain on PC
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to add a Windows 10 computer to a domain .
#Text=You can add a computer to a domain using the Control Panel or Windows Settings .
#Text=After you join your computer to a local domain , you can log in to the domain at the Windows Sign In screen .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Click the Windows Start button .
#Text=It 's the button that has the Windows logo .
#Text=By default , it can be found in the task bar in the lower-left corner .
#Text=This displays the Windows Start menu .
#Text=Type and press .
#Text=This displays the Control Panel in the Windows Start menu .
#Text=It 's the app that has an icon that resembles a computer screen with graphs .
#Text=Click the Control Panel , or press the Enter key to open the Control Panel .
#Text=Click .
#Text=It 's the green text next to the icon that resembles a blue shield next to a planet .
#Text=This opens the System and Security Settings menu .
#Text=Click .
#Text=It 's the green text next to an icon that resembles a computer screen .
#Text=This displays system information .
#Text=Click .
#Text=This is across from the computer name , domain and work group information .
#Text=This displays the System Properties menu .
#Text=Click the tab .
#Text=It 's the first tab at the top of the System Properties menu .
#Text=Click .
#Text=It 's the last button in the System Properties menu .
#Text=Click .
#Text=It 's the first radial button at the bottom of the " Computer Name/Domain Changes " .

column1: #Text=You can select a Domain or Workgroup .
#Text=Type the domain name and click .
#Text=Type the name or URL of the domain you would like to join .
#Text=If you are not sure what the domain name is , consult the network administrator .
#Text=Type an administrator 's username and password and click .
#Text=You need to have permission from a network administrator to join a domain .
#Text=Type a network administrator 's username and password and click Ok to join .
#Text=Click .
#Text=You may see a welcome prompt , and a prompt advising you to restart your computer .
#Text=Click Ok to acknowledge .
#Text=Click .
#Text=This closes the System Properties window .
#Text=A prompt immediately displays asking you to restart your computer .
#Text=Click .
#Text=Before you log in to the domain with your computer , it must be restarted .
#Text=If prompted , click Restart Now .
#Text=If you are not prompted to restart your computer , use the following steps to restart .
#Text=Click the Windows Start button .
#Text=Click the icon with the circle with a line through the top .
#Text=Click Restart
#Text=Click .
#Text=After your computer restarts , you can log in to your computer locally using your Windows username and password , or click Other User in the lower-left corner to log in to the domain .
#Text=Type the domain name/administrator 's username .
#Text=In the first bar where you would normally type your Windows username , type the domain followed by a slash ( / ) , then followed by an administrator 's username .
#Text=For example , " Company/adminstrator " .
#Text=Type the administrative password and press .
#Text=Type an administrative password in the box below the bar with the domain and user name .
#Text=Press the Enter key , or click the arrow to the side of the password bar to log in to the domain .
